parameters.name: markSeen
parameters.label: Mark email message(s) as read when fetched

filter.name: If the email doesn't have attachments

messages.content: You are an AI specialized in document data extraction and JSON structuring.

Your task is to read the text extracted from a Gmail email body and produce clean, accurate, structured JSON strictly following the required fields.

RULES:
1. Only extract information from the provided email text. Do not invent or assume missing values.
2. Output must always be valid JSON and must contain only the following keys:

- "vendor_name"
- "invoice_number"
- "invoice_date"
- "due_date"
- "total_amount"
- "invoice_description"
- "sender_email"
- "file_url"

3. All fields must be strings unless they are null.
4. Do NOT include commentary, explanation, or extra text—return JSON only.
5. Preserve original formatting of dates and numbers unless ambiguous.
6. The “invoice_description” should summarize the line-items or service descriptions found within the email content.
7. The “sender_email” will be provided as part of the email metadata.

mapper.name: MissingFields
mapper.value: {{(if(12.vendor_name = null; "Vendor Name") + if(12.invoice_number = null; "Invoice Number") + if(12.invoice_date = null; "Invoice Date") + if(12.due_date = null; "Due Date") + if(12.total_amount = null; "Total Amount") + if(12.invoice_description = null; "Invoice Description"))}}

mapper.content:
The fields listed below are missing kindly recheck and resond with the correct invoice: <br/ >
{{65.MissingFields}}

replyMode.label: Reply to all (original sender, CCs, and known BCCs)

mapper.content:
The are missing fields from the invoices are listed below: <br/ >
{{65.MissingFields}}

messages.message: Referenced module 'OpenRouter - Create a Chat Completion' [8] is not accessible.

filter.name: If the email has an attachment

expect.name: returnAttachmentData
expect.label: Return media or attachment file data

messages.content: You are an AI specialized in document data extraction and JSON structuring.

Your task is to read the text extracted from a PDF (already converted by PDF.co) and produce clean, accurate, structured JSON strictly following the required fields.

RULES:
1. Only extract information from the provided text. Do not invent or assume missing values.
2. Output must always be valid JSON and must contain only the following keys:

- "vendor_name"
- "invoice_number"
- "invoice_date"
- "due_date"
- "total_amount"
- "invoice_description"
- "sender_email"
- "file_url"

4. Do NOT include commentary, explanation, or extra text—return JSON only.
5. Preserve original formatting of dates and numbers unless ambiguous.
6. The “invoice_description” should be all the line-items or service descriptions found within the document combined together, don't summarise it or leave anything out.


Your job is to return a clean, precise, single JSON object with the above keys every time.

mapper.name: MissingFields
mapper.value: {{(if(13.vendor_name = null; "Vendor Name") + if(13.invoice_number = null; "Invoice Number") + if(13.invoice_date = null; "Invoice Date") + if(13.due_date = null; "Due Date") + if(13.total_amount = null; "Total Amount") + if(13.invoice_description = null; "Invoice Description"))}}

mapper.content:
The fields listed below are missing kindly recheck and resond with the correct invoice: <br/ >
{{70.MissingFields}}

replyMode.label: Reply to all (original sender, CCs, and known BCCs)

mapper.content:
The are missing fields from the invoices are listed below: <br/ >
{{70.MissingFields}}
